Understate: The claim understates the number of Supreme Court justices who have been nominated and installed in an election year while a presidential election is already underway.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it contradicts historical evidence of Supreme Court justices being nominated and installed in an election year.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes a problematic assumption that a Supreme Court nominee cannot be nominated and installed while a presidential election is already underway.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation that the nomination and installation of Supreme Court justices in an election year have occurred in instances where the president running for reelection and the Senate majority were of the same party.
